ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: So much! My writing and typing improved tremendously. Lee ssn is so quick with feedback as well. My vocabulary also became much broader because she always put tough words in the zoom chat that we could see how to spell and internalize. Finally, through all of the breakout rooms and projects, I feel so much more fluent and natural in conversation. I feel comfortable holding a long and deep conversation in Korean now.
Angela teacher was so supportive and so kind. She made me want to work harder and learn more about my culture and values.
I gained a lot of cultural knowledge about Korea and its traditions/history. I also reviewed some vocab from L3 and refreshed some grammar.
I learned lots of advanced Korean vocabulary for a variety of real-world situations. I also learned how to speak in Korean with my peers in formal and informal conversations.
The assignments primarily focus on proper reading and writing skills, while including aspects of cultural learning and speaking in class.
I developed Korean speaking skills and more conversational vocabulary
I was able to practice more of my casual and formal speaking skills as well as learn how to more proficiently read and write Korean.
I increased my speaking, writing, critical analysis, cultural awareness, and oral creativity in Korean.
My Korean speaking and reading skills improved tremendously.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Only strengths. Lee ssn is the biggest strength. She is the best teacher and person. The curriculum is amazing. She makes it herself, and it is so well-tailored to our interests. Every project is super fun and engaging, my favorite being the story-telling one. What an incredible class.

Strengths: Lee ssn is amazing. such great energy. The class community is also great.
Weaknesses: participation was low, but probably because of Zoom. Breakout rooms were big oof

Strengths: get to do creative projects, learn lots of vocabulary, learn about Korean culture through stories and history. Prof. Lee-Smith is a very approachable and energetic professor who makes learning very engaging and fun.

Weaknesses: class sometimes goes over 11:20, which was not a problem bc of remote learning, but it might be during an in person semester where it takes some time to get to the next class.
Lee ssn goat
I think that this class adapted really well to an online format, and appreciated all the discussion time we had in a way that did not feel stressful. I think the TA sessions were also helpful.

Professor Lee is one of the best professors at Yale.
The class also provides a great community of Korean speakers.
The weakness would be that it was on zoom, but other than that, this was one of the best classes I ever took.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The breakout rooms succeeded in this course. I think it was because the students were all very eager to actually learn Korean, and also because Lee ssn is so awesome. She would come check in on us regularly and talk with us in breakout rooms.
I really liked how Professor Lee-Smith reviewed and wrote suggestions for every one of our writing assignments. It really helped me fix any grammar and spelling mistakes.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: YES!!! Best class ever. Lee ssn is the kindest, most thoughtful person you will ever get to know. What a pleasure being in this class. You won't regret it. You'll make friends, learn so much Korean, and have fun doing it. What could you possibly want more out of a class?

Compared to L3 it was less rigorous with vocab and grammar (I think I fell off a bit in those areas), but Lee Ssn was great and so was the community. Would definitely take again just for those two reasons.

I would absolutely recommend this course! This was my favorite class of the semester. If you want to improve Korean by being in an immersive environment, have conversations about all kinds of topics, doing creative projects with peers, then this is the class for you.
Lee ssn is the best
If you are a heritage speaker I would absolutely recommend this course, Prof. Lee is so kind and helpful, and you get a lot out of an immersive class.
I would 100% recommend this class with Professor Lee. She is so sweet and understanding. She makes being in class so fun.
Yes
Yes, Teacher Lee is a caring professors who genuinely cares about her students. It was a pleasure and joy being in her class.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
